folder: Pearl Street & Park Row, Manhattan, NY
text:
Pearl Street, at, adjoining and south of the S.W1. corner of Park Row, as seen from Park Row with the Second and Third Aves., Elevated in the fore.
ground.
About 1914.
title: Manhattan: Pearl Street - Park Row

folder: Park Row & Pearl Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
Park Row, at, adjoining and south of the S.W. corner of Pearl Street. Also shown is Pearl Street, south side, west from Park Row. (Park Row is arbitrarily set to run north and south). (Pearl Street, when west of Park Pow, proceeds east and west). The view shows the Second and Third Ave., Elevated overhead on Park Row.
September 1, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
4. Park Row & Pearl St., n.w. cor. Neg. A-11
P.L. Sperr, photographer  July 19, 1941
title: Manhattan: Park Row - Pearl Street

folder: Park Row & Pearl Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
Park Row, at, adjoining and south of the S.W. corner of Pearl Street. Also shown is Pearl Street, south side, west from Park Row. (Park Row is arbitrarily set to run north and south). (Pearl Street, when west of Park Pow, proceeds east and west). The view shows the Second and Third Ave., Elevated overhead on Park Row.
September 1, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
4. Park Row & Pearl St., n.w. cor. Neg. A-11
P.L. Sperr, photographer  July 19, 1941
title: Manhattan: Park Row - Pearl Street

folder: Pearl Street & Cardinal Place, Manhattan, NY
text:
(1)
Pearl Street, west from Cardinal Plaoe, to, but not including Park Street. The view shows the rear of the old Dept., of Health Building, at
the S.E. corner of Park Street.
September 30, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, at a later date and showing the new Federal Courts Building in the process of construction on the site of the former Board of Health
Building.
October 8, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.

folder: Park Row & Pearl Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
116-120 Park Row, west side, between Pearl and Duane Streets.
April 21, 1917.
Underwood & Underwood,
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
title: Manhattan: Park Row - Pearl Street

folder: Pearl Street & Park Row, Manhattan, NY
text:
(1)
Pearl Street, west from but not including Park Row, to and including Cardinal Place. The 3-story building (No. 466) adjoining
the N.W. corner of Park Row is a frame house.
March 27, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, showing a closer view of No. 466.
1932.
J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York.
Negative No. 6.
(3)
Another view showing also the corner building at the Bowery.
October 7, 1930.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
S, P3 Ncg.2E 326
BN
